section.title: Overview
section.p: The unit type defines the type of unit such as time, volume, money, and unit. All the entities with units use the unit type entity to define the type of that unit. For example, monetary bucket has a unit type as 'Money'.
The units and conversions entity allows you to define and convert units from one type to another. You can define how a given type can be converted to any other type using this entity.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: Log into the SM GUI, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration > COMMON tab and select Units Mapping from the hamburger menu ( ). To add a new unit, click to add basic details as described in the given table:

row.entry: This parameter indicates a unit name to measure charging factors, such as volume, time, unit, or money.
This parameter indicates the short name of the unit used in the display of this unit type. For example, MB, sec.
This parameter indicates the type of unit that the service operator selects from the predefined set of values.

entry.p: Select one from the predefined set of unit types:

row.entry: This parameter indicates whether it is a base unit or not.

entry.p: Select either of the values from the drop-down list:

li.p: true: indicates this is a base unit type
false: indicates this is not a base unit type.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the security domain associated with the unit type.
Select the required security domain from the predefined security domains in the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the value for conversion. For example, 1 MB.
This parameter indicates the converted value. For example, 1048576 bytes.
